citation.fr:
[{"type": "dataset", "id": "ca.cioos_dcb7ed2e-bce9-40c5-a197-71ac6b46bd5c", "author": [{"given": "Julien", "family": "Laliberte"}, {"literal": "Fisheries and Oceans Canada"}], "issued": [{"date-parts": ["2024", "08", "05"]}], "abstract": "La couleur de l'eau de mer, vue de l'espace, permet d'estimer le contenu en chlorophylle dans l'eau. Ce pigment est un indice de la biomasse des algues microscopiques. Par rapport à l'océan Atlantique, les eaux de l'estuaire et du golfe du St-Laurent sont plutôt isolées et sont fortement mélangées à l'eau douce en provenance de nombreuses rivières. 

La méthode pour retrouver la chlorophylle doit être adaptée à ces spécificités. Ce jeu de données présente le résultat d'une méthode développée pour retrouver la concentration de chlorophylle-a dérivée par divers satellites (5) dans l'estuaire et le golfe du Saint-Laurent. Les deux satellites (AQUA et VIIRS) sont toujours actifs et collectent des données journalières.

NOTE D'UTILISATION : Les données maillées sont disponibles en visualisation et téléchargement via la plateforme ERDDAP, et les fichiers originaux non-maillés sont inclus en format CSV dans les ressources.

Ce jeu de données constitue la première version du modèle. Pour accéder aux versions ultérieures, veuillez consultez [**ce lien**](https://catalogue.ogsl.ca/fr/dataset/ca-cioos_969715ba-3747-42ec-b8b4-6280403562d4). 

Ce projet fait partie du Programme sur les données environnementales côtières de référence de Pêches et Océans Canada.", "edition": "", "edition-date": "", "publisher": "", "title": "Données satellitaires de chlorophylle-a pour l'estuaire et le golfe du St-Laurent", "DOI": "10.26071/ogsl-5mak-9r77", "language": "fr", "URL": "https://catalogue.ogsl.ca/dataset/ca-cioos_dcb7ed2e-bce9-40c5-a197-71ac6b46bd5c?local=fr"}]
citation.en:
[{"type": "dataset", "id": "ca.cioos_dcb7ed2e-bce9-40c5-a197-71ac6b46bd5c", "author": [{"given": "Julien", "family": "Laliberte"}, {"literal": "Fisheries and Oceans Canada"}], "issued": [{"date-parts": ["2024", "08", "05"]}], "abstract": "The colour of seawater, seen from space, is used to estimate the chlorophyll content in the water. This pigment is an index of the biomass of microscopic algae. Compared to the Atlantic Ocean, the waters of the Estuary and the Gulf of St. Lawrence are rather isolated and are strongly mixed with fresh water from many rivers. 

The method for retrieving chlorophyll must be adapted to these specificities. This dataset presents the result of a method developed to find the concentration of chlorophyll-a derived by various satellites (5) in the estuary and the Gulf of St. Lawrence. The two satellites (AQUA and VIIRS) are still active and collect daily data.

NOTE OF USE: The gridded data are available for viewing and downloading via the ERDDAP platform, and the original non-gridded files are included in CSV format in the resources.

This dataset is the first version of the model. To access later versions, please refer to [**this link**](https://catalogue.ogsl.ca/en/dataset/ca-cioos_969715ba-3747-42ec-b8b4-6280403562d4). 

This project is part of the Coastal Environmental Baseline Program Initiative under the Oceans Protection Plan of Fisheries and Oceans Canada.", "edition": "", "edition-date": "", "publisher": "", "title": "Chlorophyll-a Satellite Data for the Estuary and the Gulf of St. Lawrence", "DOI": "10.26071/ogsl-5mak-9r77", "language": "en", "URL": "https://catalogue.ogsl.ca/dataset/ca-cioos_dcb7ed2e-bce9-40c5-a197-71ac6b46bd5c?local=en"}]

      <mri:abstract xsi:type="lan:PT_FreeText_PropertyType">
        <gco:CharacterString>La couleur de l'eau de mer, vue de l'espace, permet d'estimer le contenu en chlorophylle dans l'eau. Ce pigment est un indice de la biomasse des algues microscopiques. Par rapport √† l'oc√©an Atlantique, les eaux de l'estuaire et du golfe du St-Laurent sont plut√¥t isol√©es et sont fortement m√©lang√©es √† l'eau douce en provenance de nombreuses rivi√®res. 

La m√©thode pour retrouver la chlorophylle doit √™tre adapt√©e √† ces sp√©cificit√©s. Ce jeu de donn√©es pr√©sente le r√©sultat d'une m√©thode d√©velopp√©e pour retrouver la concentration de chlorophylle-a d√©riv√©e par divers satellites (5) dans l'estuaire et le golfe du Saint-Laurent. Les deux satellites (AQUA et VIIRS) sont toujours actifs et collectent des donn√©es journali√®res.

NOTE D'UTILISATION : Les donn√©es maill√©es sont disponibles en visualisation et t√©l√©chargement via la plateforme ERDDAP, et les fichiers originaux non-maill√©s sont inclus en format CSV dans les ressources.

Ce jeu de donn√©es constitue la premi√®re version du mod√®le. Pour acc√©der aux versions ult√©rieures, veuillez consultez [**ce lien**](https://catalogue.ogsl.ca/fr/dataset/ca-cioos_969715ba-3747-42ec-b8b4-6280403562d4). 

Ce projet fait partie du Programme sur les donn√©es environnementales c√¥ti√®res de r√©f√©rence de P√™ches et Oc√©ans Canada.</gco:CharacterString>
        <lan:PT_FreeText>
          <lan:textGroup>
            <lan:LocalisedCharacterString locale="#en">The colour of seawater, seen from space, is used to estimate the chlorophyll content in the water. This pigment is an index of the biomass of microscopic algae. Compared to the Atlantic Ocean, the waters of the Estuary and the Gulf of St. Lawrence are rather isolated and are strongly mixed with fresh water from many rivers. 

The method for retrieving chlorophyll must be adapted to these specificities. This dataset presents the result of a method developed to find the concentration of chlorophyll-a derived by various satellites (5) in the estuary and the Gulf of St. Lawrence. The two satellites (AQUA and VIIRS) are still active and collect daily data.

NOTE OF USE: The gridded data are available for viewing and downloading via the ERDDAP platform, and the original non-gridded files are included in CSV format in the resources.

This dataset is the first version of the model. To access later versions, please refer to [**this link**](https://catalogue.ogsl.ca/en/dataset/ca-cioos_969715ba-3747-42ec-b8b4-6280403562d4). 

This project is part of the Coastal Environmental Baseline Program Initiative under the Oceans Protection Plan of Fisheries and Oceans Canada.</lan:LocalisedCharacterString>
          </lan:textGroup>
        </lan:PT_FreeText>
      </mri:abstract>

name: ca-cioos_dcb7ed2e-bce9-40c5-a197-71ac6b46bd5c
notes:
The colour of seawater, seen from space, is used to estimate the chlorophyll content in the water. This pigment is an index of the biomass of microscopic algae. Compared to the Atlantic Ocean, the waters of the Estuary and the Gulf of St. Lawrence are rather isolated and are strongly mixed with fresh water from many rivers. 

The method for retrieving chlorophyll must be adapted to these specificities. This dataset presents the result of a method developed to find the concentration of chlorophyll-a derived by various satellites (5) in the estuary and the Gulf of St. Lawrence. The two satellites (AQUA and VIIRS) are still active and collect daily data.

NOTE OF USE: The gridded data are available for viewing and downloading via the ERDDAP platform, and the original non-gridded files are included in CSV format in the resources.

This dataset is the first version of the model. To access later versions, please refer to [**this link**](https://catalogue.ogsl.ca/en/dataset/ca-cioos_969715ba-3747-42ec-b8b4-6280403562d4). 

This project is part of the Coastal Environmental Baseline Program Initiative under the Oceans Protection Plan of Fisheries and Oceans Canada.

description_translated.en:
Created in 2005 by federal and provincial government as well as academic institutions and community organizations, the St. Lawrence Global Observatory (SLGO) makes it possible to maximize the benefits of data collection by integrating multidisciplinary data from multiple partners on a single web portal. Promoting data discovery and re-use, SLGO counts 48 members and is recognized throughout the world.

The content distributed by SLGO spans across all disciplines, themes and areas of interest that data-producing members choose to make accessible. A large amount of scientific and environmental information is already available through SLGO's portal. Furthermore, in order to maximize data availability, SLGO's team develops user-friendly web applications to facilitate data visualization and download in various formats.

SLGO is, as such, responsible for the activities of the region of the St. Lawrence of CIOOS. To contribute, we invite you to contact us.
